title: How to Smoke in Your House Without Your Parents Finding Out

steps.title: Find a private place to smoke it.
steps.content: Find a private place to smoke it. If at all possible, make it an outdoor spot. Part of the garage, or an area under your deck are both good choices. If an outdoor spot isn’t an option, you can use the bathroom. A bedroom isn’t a great spot to smoke if you’re trying to hide it. There are a lot of fabrics that will soak in the smoke and it will be hard to mask the smell.

steps.title: Timing your smoke breaks.
steps.content: Timing your smoke breaks. If you’re disappearing to smoke every hour, your parents will get suspicious. Time your breaks wisely. Use other excuses to get a moment away. Before you shower. Using the bathroom after a meal. Nightly phone call from your boyfriend/girlfriend.

steps.title: Block gaps in the door.
steps.content: Block gaps in the door. Using a towel, plug the cracks between the door frame and the door. Freshly laundered towels will produce a more pleasant smell as air moves through them. If you’re outside or using a garage, don’t worry about this.

steps.title: Use a window.
steps.content: Use a window. If you’re inside, be sure to exhale through an open window. Not only will this force the majority of the smell outside, but it will help aerate the smell that’s inside.

steps.title: Use a fan.
steps.content: Use a fan. Having ventilation planned is key to hiding the smell of smoke. Placing a portable fan at a window can help control air flow and diffuse the hazy, smelly cloud of smoke. Use a room that already has a fan. Carrying a fan around with you is suspicious.

steps.title: Cover your clothes.
steps.content: Cover your clothes. Using a lightweight jacket, sweatshirt, or long sleeve shirt will help keep the smoke from clinging to your clothes. Leave this cover-up in your smoking spot. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Light a smudge stick.
steps.content: Light a smudge stick. A smudge stick is basically a bundle of dried herbs. It acts as a heavy duty incense stick. This will not only mask the scent, but also make any escaped smoke less suspicious. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use cologne/body spray/air fresheners.
steps.content: Use cologne/body spray/air fresheners. Spray these before and after you smoke. This way, you don’t overuse it and cause your parents to be skeptical. You don’t want them wondering why it smells like you took a bath in it. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use an odor neutralizer.
steps.content: Use an odor neutralizer. Ozium is an odor neutralizer that inhibits the ability of the nose to smell anything other than the neutralizer. This is commonly used to produce the “new car smell” and can fix many other problem smells. Spray according to the directions and only use it directly before you leave the room. Want tips on how to get rid of the smell of weed in your room? Check out wikiHow's "How to get rid of weed smell from a room?" forum !

steps.title: Freshen your breath.
steps.content: Freshen your breath. Brush your teeth immediately after smoking. If your smoking spot is outside and you have to cross your parents before getting into the bathroom, use chewing gum to freshen your breath. You can also hide the smell by eating something with a strong odor, like onions or garlic. Of course, if you go this route, you’ll smell like onions or garlic, but that might be better than smelling like smoke. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wash your hands.
steps.content: Wash your hands. Using a strong scented soap, wash your hands as thoroughly as possible. If this is not enough, you can also use a scented moisturizer or scented hand sanitizer. You can also mask the scent on your hands by eating an orange. Peeling the orange will leave the juice and scent of oranges on your hands. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Use rubbing alcohol.
steps.content: Use rubbing alcohol. You can clean any tar on your skin with rubbing alcohol. Isopropyl alcohol can be safely applied to skin. It will dry out your skin so be sure to have scented moisturizer with you as well. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Shampoo your hair.
steps.content: Shampoo your hair. Your hair absorbs the smell of cigarette smoke because it is porous and absorbs the particles of smoke. This smell is retained for a long time. The only way to get the smell out of your hair is to take a shower and use a good shampoo. Using a coconut shampoo and scented hair styling product will help mask the smell. [7] X Research source
